definition: to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: A heavy shower drench the camp ers.
sentences.chinese: 一阵骤雨把露营者都淋湿了。

sentences.english: Showers are expected tomorrow due to the southwesterly airstream induced by SARIKA.
sentences.chinese: 莎莉嘉引进的西南气流将继续于明天为香港带来骤雨。

sentences.english: A heavy downpour interrupted the football match.
sentences.chinese: 一场骤雨中断了这场足球赛。

sentences.english: The savages greeted us with a shower of stones and arrows.
sentences.chinese: 那些野人用骤雨般的石头和箭来迎候我们。

sentences.english: Faith in Christ will keep us steady in the stormy sea of change.
sentences.chinese: 生命虽经狂风骤雨，信靠基督使我们安稳无惧。

sentences.english: Cuba could get torrential rainfalls of up to 30 inches.
sentences.chinese: 古巴的骤雨降雨量达到了30英寸。

sentences.english: It never rains but it pours, kitano hid the siege suddenly like a storm raids.
sentences.chinese: 祸不单行，北野武藏的围攻忽然如狂风骤雨般袭来。

sentences.english: You protected us through gusty winds and torrential rains, and even used the storm to bless us.
sentences.chinese: 祢保护我们经历狂风骤雨，甚至使用暴风雨祝福我们。
与巴基斯坦暴风骤雨般的关系？

sentences.english: I firmly believe that after the storm, there is always a beautiful rainbow appears.
sentences.chinese: 我坚信，在暴风骤雨后，总会有一条美丽的彩虹出现。

sentences.english: Rain may flood the low-lying land out.
sentences.chinese: 这场骤雨有可能把低洼地淹没。

sentences.english: The ship made little headway in the storm.
sentences.chinese: 航船在暴风骤雨中几乎无法前进。

sentences.english: One would say that the sun was thirsty. A shower is but a glass of water; a rainstorm is instantly drunk up.
sentences.chinese: 太阳好象渴了，骤雨等于一杯水，一阵雨立刻被喝尽。

definition: howling wind and torrential rain (idiom)/(fig.) difficult, dangerous situation
fine rain/drizzle/poem by Tang poet Li Shangyin 李商隱|李商隐
sudden clap of thunder/fig. surprising turn of events
a downpour/rain bucketing down/fig. to be overwhelmed (with work or things to study)
